meta.title: Lakeside Union School District / Lakeside Union Homepage

meta.name: description
meta.content: Lakeside Union School District is a K-8 public school district in Lakeside, CA known for its Spanish and Mandarin immersion program, as well as an award-winning performing and visual arts district.

p.span: While our buildings are closed, school continues through LUSD’s Distance Learning Plan. LUSD teachers worked together to develop common, standards-based lessons for each grade level. Each teacher has built a virtual classroom in which the lessons will be delivered. Access to the lessons and the teachers’ virtual classrooms are provided through the Distance Learning Website.

img.title: Lakeside Union School District Link to Website
img.alt: Lakeside Union School District Link to Website

a.title: Go to comments for LUSD Distance Learning Plan

span.strong: Meals can be picked up at the District Office (12335 Woodside Avenue, Lakeside 92040) Monday-Friday from 11:00-12:30. Lunch and breakfast for the next day will be distributed for children ages 2-18. Students MUST be present to receive the meals.

Las comidas se pueden recoger en la Oficina del Distrito (12335 Woodside Avenue, Lakeside 92040) de lunes a viernes de 11:00am-12:30pm. El almuerzo y el desayuno del día siguiente se distribuirán para niños de 2 a 18 años. Los estudiantes DEBEN estar presentes para recibir las comidas.

a.title: Go to comments for Meal Availability

p.span: All Lakeside Union School District schools are closed indefinitely pending further guidance from state and local officials. During the closure all emails will be checked regularly by school staff (with the exception of our Spring Break from April 6-17). We will also be checking school office voicemail messages and getting back to you in a timely manner. Please continue to check your email for LUSD Communications. Thank you for your patience during this trying time.

En respuesta al brote de COVID-19, el Distrito Escolar de Lakeside estará cerrado indefinidamente en espera de más orientación de los funcionarios estatales y locales. En un intento para mantener las operaciones de negocios mientras las escuelas están cerradas, nuestro personal revisará y responderá periódicamente los correos electrónicos y las llamadas de teléfono de forma remota para minimizar el contacto de persona a persona. Gracias por su comprensión.

span.h2: Please visit this link for curriculum support during this time:

a.title: Go to comments for School Closure Indefinitely

span.p: Registration for the 20/21 School Year is now open.
During current school closure you may email any registration questions to Teri Cook at tcook@lsusd.net

a.title: Go to comments for Registration for the 20/21 School Year

span.p: The Local Control and Accountability Plan (LCAP) presents an opportunity to measure the factors that are important to produce a well-rounded education for all students. As part of our process, we are asking for feedback that will be utilized to assess our progress toward meeting our objectives. This opportunity affords stakeholders a voice in the way the district and our schools will hold themselves accountable.
Please fill out the survey to have a voice in the LCAP:
Parents/Guardians: LCAP Parent/Guardian Input 2020
District Employees: LCAP District Employee Input 2020

El Plan de Control y Responsabilidad Local (LCAP) presenta una oportunidad para medir los factores que son importantes para producir una educación integral para todos los estudiantes. Cómo parte de nuestro proceso, solicitamos comentarios que se utilizarán para evaluar nuestro progreso hacia el cumplimiento de nuestros objetivos. Esta oportunidad brinda a los interesados una voz en la forma en que el distrito y nuestras escuelas se harán responsables.
Complete la encuesta para tener voz en el "Plan de Control y Responsabilidad" (LCAP):
Padres/Tutores: Aportación para LCAP de Padres/Tutores, 2020

a.title: Go to comments for LCAP Parent/Guardian/Teacher Input, 2020

span.p: If you are interested in one of our language immersion programs for your incoming Kindergarten student, please complete this form.

em.strong: Immersion parent information meeting will be held on Tuesday, February 25 at 6:00 pm at Lakeside Middle School Theater, located at 11833 Woodside Avenue, Lakeside.
School tour dates will be posted on school websites for Lakeview, Lemon Crest and Winter Gardens/Riverview

span.p: Enrollment will began March 1, 2020

a.title: Go to comments for Immersion Interest Form 2020/2021

em.strong: Kindergarten registration began on March 1, 2020 via our online parent portal. Your student must turn 5 years old by September 1 to be eligible for Kindergarten. For more information visit our Kindergarten Information page

a.title: Go to comments for Kindergarten Information!

span.p: Registration for Transitional Kindergarten began March 1, 2020 with our online parent portal. Children turning 5 years old between September 2nd and December 2nd, 2020 qualify for our TK program.

Our interest list to determine staffing was made available on the school website beginning February 1. For more information please select Eucalyptus Hills from Our Schools drop down menu at top of this page.

a.title: Go to comments for TK Enrollment

span.p: The California Healthy Kids Survey (CHKS) is a powerful tool for use in K-12 schools that can help schools and districts accurately identify areas of student and school strengths and weaknesses, and address related needs. It provides a comprehensive, data-driven, decision-making process to guide efforts to improve school climate, learning supports, and engagement, as well as identify and increase the quality of health, prevention, and youth development programs. CHKS assesses a broad range of key learning and health-related indicators and collects student data on attitudes, behaviors, and experiences related to school and learning. School connectedness, developmental supports and opportunities, safety, violence and harassment, substance use, and physical and mental health are some of the key areas assessed by the survey. The research-based assessment of factors that promote resilience and positive youth development is one of the surveys many unique benefits. The CHKS allows schools and districts to receive relevant, useful knowledge that may be used in guiding service/program development. Please visit the California Healthy Kids Site to view the prior years' data for LUSD.
2019 CHKS - Elementary Core Module - English - 5th Grade
2019 CHKS - Elementary Core Module - Spanish - 5th Grade
2019 CHKS - Elementary Social Emotional Health - English - 5th Grade
2019 CHKS - Elementary Social Emotional Health - Spanish - 5th Grade

2019 CHKS - Middle School Core Module - Spanish - 7th Grade

span.h4: Parents of students in grades K-8 are highly encouraged to participate in the 2019-20 California Healthy Kids Survey. If you have more than one child attending Lakeside Schools, please access your eldest child's school survey from the links below. Please participate on or before December 20, 2019. This survey is available in English, Spanish and Arabic. For questions, please contact (619) 390-2600 ext 2760.

a.title: Go to comments for California Healthy Kids Survey Resources

span.p: Open Enrollment window for the upcoming school year is February 1 - May15 (extended from April 15 due to the shut down) annually. Parents may submit a request for an Inter-district permit or School of Choice form at any time during the school year. Applications will be processed and decision results will be provided to parents within 30 days of receiving the application request form.

Applications during open enrollment that are received after the April 15th deadline will be placed on our waiting list. Waiting list applicants will be informed as soon as slots appear, which may not happen until after the new school year has started.
Which one does my student need?

ul.li: Inter District Transfer - you do not live within the attendance boundary for Lakeside and wish to attend one of our schools
School of Choice - you live in Lakeside and are choosing a school other than your home attendance area

a.title: Go to comments for Inter District Transfer/School of Choice

div.div: Accessibility Notice: LSUSD is committed to ensuring that its website is accessible for all users and is in the process of making important updates with that in mind. If you experience difficulty accessing a page, link, or document, please contact us at webmaster@lsusd.net and request this information in an alternate format.
